title: (x) Veer's fancy logo - custom design created in-house at Veer by Drew Ng {Grant}
content:
Does anyone know what font is used for veer's fancy logo, or have reccomendations for a similar font to be used for headlines. I'm looking for a script or italic font that is decorative without being overly saccharine. Thanks for any help!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120507001120im_/http:/typophile.com/files/VPR0001170_P3_6650.jpg)
author: caryn

comments.content:
I believe it's Expletive Script.

- Lex

[Not quite,](http://web.archive.org/web/20120507001120/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=VIT0000007) but it would be a good alternative.

- Lex

I think you might be right about Expletive Lex, but I think a bit of customization has been applied, or alse all the optional characters are not shown. For example the 'f' could be made by flipping a second 'f' (notice the loops look symmetrical?), and editing a bit. The 'n' also seems to have been edited from something else, but the a, c and y look exactly the same to me.

- Mike Yanega

The 'y' could be made from an 'f' and a 'u' as well. At least I'm not going completely insane :^)

- Lex

The Fancy logo is a custom design created in-house at Veer by Drew Ng. There is certainly a bit of serendipitous inspiration from Barnbrook’s Expletive Script, but Drew’s original sketches indicate that many other point of reference were used as well.
